public class NameGenderGenerator

This class generates random names and genders.

Patrick McMorran

Constructor Detail

NameGenderGenerator

public NameGenderGenerator(java.sql.Connection c,
                           int i,
                           boolean u,
                           boolean[] u2)
Parameters:
c - This Connection object is used for the generator to interact with the database.
i - This integer is used to designate what gender name the generator should produce. Male = 0, Female = 1, Both = 2.
u - This is a boolean value that denotes whether the generator should generate unique values. true = unique, false = nonunique;
u2 - This boolean array designates what data the generator should output. Array[0] = First Name Array[1] = Last Name Array[2] = Gender
Method Detail

PrepareGenerator

public void PrepareGenerator()
This is used to prepare the generator, creating required tables in the database, loading required data into memory, and handling any other dependencies.

nextTuple

public java.lang.String[] nextTuple()

DisassembleGenerator

public void DisassembleGenerator()
This performs cleanup operations, deleting temporary tables and indices.
